Bzn9BfHjMhg-Do7Kfydcgw.text: I have to eat gluten free, i have tried the GF buffalo chicken pizza and healthy option with veggies and chicken... the BEST GF pizza i have ever had. I really hope they stick around. Im very impressed with it.

H-aqa2-lLGGlLZA5uo6jCQ.text: I've been ordering lunch at work from the same greasy pizza place for the past year because it was, sadly, the better option in my area. Then I saw this place pop up on Eat24 and decided to try it.   I got the care pizza on wheat crust with garlic olive oil sauce. Its basically a burrito that blew up on a pizza...and it works so well. Huge generous chunks of avocado make it a healthy but fatty melody in my mouth. And afterwords, I didn't have the dirty sinking feeling I usually get when eating pizza.   This shit is clean, I wouldn't say healthy, but definitely the healthiest option when talking about pizzas. I don't see myself ordering from anywhere else in a good while.

arCSk32Vo0dMY0cR1vUjtw.text: When will I ever learn- when you go to a pizza joint that specializes in delivery and take out- never ever order anything but the pizza. I made the big mistake of ordering soup! It was rainy and I was craving Italian wedding soup- big big mistake! Two tiny meatballs a spoonful of round little pasta and a quart of dishwater! Had to dump it out- unbelievably bad. Now on a good note- I also had a mini lunch pizza - pretty good- not great but four star pizza. So advice- when in a new pizza place- do not order soup- like when in a sports bar do not order lasagna!

wSWJ6SIwsZQL9x8kzR1UtA.text: Is it the best pizza in the world? No, def not. However, it's the best delivery pizza option in Pittsburgh for semi-health conscious folk. You can pile it high with veggies and chicken or anchovies, plus get it on a whole-wheat, multigrain, or gf crust. If I'm ordering pizza in this is the place!

IgdkUf7Rhn65fNUNZUKvWg.text: Horrible pizza. We got the Margarita Pizza we couldn't even eat it and that has never happened before. the sauce is way too sweet and under seasoned. We each ate a piece threw our $19 pizza in the garbage.

AhKPTo_iYJAMZeA-t82XIw.text: The pizza was okay... It reminded me of like a slightly better little Caesars. Hey it was cheap why am I really complaining.  Well.... I dined at noon on a weekday in the summer. The building was empty- no biggie- except I was stared at almost the entire time I was eating. The most awkward note to eat ever. Service here is terrible, paired with the "EHH" food I do not recommend!   Sign on the front said grand opening so maybe new owners because the previous results were so great!

q5pIQQdTxjCn70SlGUqlbw.text: First and foremost, it's not the worst pizza I have ever had because I once went to public school. BUT, I don't understand their sentiment about healthy food or their definition of healthy is horribly skewed.  They offer three types of crust - whole wheat, unbleached white dough, and gluten free. Given the gluten free trend, I'm assuming that's their definition of "healthy". Still, I'm a fan of whole wheat crust (which is rare unless you're making your own) and decided to give it a go. I ordered a small whole wheat pizza with red sauce, mozz, mushrooms, black olives, with one half with meatballs to appease the person I was splitting with. I also ordered breaded zucchini planks because I can't just say no to that.  When the pizza got here, it was nice and hot. It smelled great. Unfortunately, the taste didn't match the appearance. The crust was soggy, the sauce was bland, and the cheese was insanely rubbery (and probably the greasiest thing I've ever tried to eat.) I could only eat one slice because everything was sliding off the flimsy triangle. Fortunately, albeit also dripping in grease (which I expected in a fried veggie), the breaded zucchini planks were okay. I reheated the leftovers the next day in the oven using a little bit of olive oil cooking spray and it crunched the crust up pretty well but the cheese was still terrible.   The moral of the story is that you can go to Trader Joe's, buy a whole wheat pizza dough ball for $1.49, a few organic cheese sticks, veggies, and frozen meatballs to retreat this meal for less than $12 and it would probably be healthier than whatever this was.  I paid $30 including the tip (for just a small greaseball pizza and 4 pieces of deep fried zucchini). I could have just gone on a Tinder date and gotten that kind of disappointment for free. :(

I4UOpuXo3V0oUEFLa55_lw.text: Do not eat the GF crust if you have Celiac!!! It's definitely not GF. I usually can deal with a little bit of unavoidable contamination but by my reaction their crust DOES actually contain gluten. Be careful. It's also very pricey given the quality of the actual pizza. Definitely a big NO-NO.

X0RZ6er8WEfekB60tepKhQ.text: I am highly impressed with this relatively new pizza restaurant in Pittsburgh. They offer a wide variety of food products at reasonable prices.   Recently, we had Pizza Care cater one of our events on campus and the food was excellent! All of the students enjoyed the pizza and sandwiches from Pizza Care. We are certainly going to order from them in the future!

RYrGRFtgDMxOjXE3Y0jT2Q.text: This is the best delivery pizza I've ever had. I ordered online through them, an XL pizza with half covered in tomatoes and half covered in bacon and pepperoni with extra sauce. When I added a fountain soda to the order they gave me the option to get breadsticks for free and I opted to get cheesy ones for an extra $2 (yeah, they got me with that). The crust is not remarkable but I love their pizza sauce. It is very sweet which might not hit everyone the right way. The ingredients they use are really good, my friend who was eating the meaty side said that it was the best pepperoni he'd ever had. The pieces are cut really well too, I'm not a vegetarian but I appreciated that I didn't have to worry about any random peps or bacon pieces on my half. The breadsticks were delicious too, the only thing is that it only has cheese on top in the middle and is cut in half lengthwise and into a bunch of slices perpendicular to that so that there are 4 non cheesy slices on the ends. I was OK with this because I love any kind of white bread that is crunchy so they were very good to me. They gave us two ranch dipping cups with the pizza and we got a marinara one which my friend liked. Getting a 32oz fountain soda was much cheaper than getting something bottled, but it did come with a ton of ice in the cup. If you're looking for quality delivery pizza, definitely get some pizza from pizza care.

1TtOZyeZGTVqMl_oJYbA6Q.text: Good food, healthy options, reasonably priced. I hope this business sticks around.

PkEkWuBzJBhVNptauglaew.text: It was a pretty meh experience to me.   Pros:  Good crust and cheese  Cons:   It took 45 minutes to get my food at 2 P.M. on a weekday and it was pretty cold by the time I got it. Put it under the broiler for a couple of minutes to get back to temperature.  The order was wrong: We ordered a large cheese pizza and hot wings. Our communications must have gotten crossed, because the pizza also came with hot sauce instead of traditional tomato sauce (which is an option for the place). It wasn't horrible, but not my preference and still an error on their part.  Price: A large pizza for $11 is reasonable. But what they call large is more like a medium at 14".   I can get an 18" for the same price at Pizza Amier, and they are of comparable quality.   Bottom Line:  I would try them again if I had limited options. Obviously the sauce mix up was a big downer, and surely they don't take that long for cold pizza as a norm. I could see this being pretty decent quality pizza.   That being said, I think Pizza Amier is my preference for delivery pizza for its price.

HJVd_bwsxiwaND9kloGQTA.text: I tried this pizza at the Duquesne University Student Government Association meeting. This business is extremely accommodating to student organizations and delivers large orders in a timely manner. They also included a ton of coupon pamphlets for students to take - a must have for frugal college students!  In regards to the taste - the pizza was great. It was extremely convincing for a "healthy pizza!" I will definitely be visiting this pizza place soon!

BOE4rdbvV5FbrfpDIIwtqQ.text: I am happy that Pizza Care offers to the community healthy pizza. They have crusts that are whole wheat, multi-grain, and gluten-free (as well as regular unhealthy crust if you still prefer that). They try to reduce the sugar, fat, and sodium as much as possible in all of their ingredients. They also sell breadsticks, hoagies, wings, soda, pasta, salad, gyros, wraps, strombolis, desserts, etc. The food still tastes good and has similar prices to other restaurants.

xdOtaAw3xx01-OgAsYWtNw.text: The Tuscan chicken pizza is amazing!  We ordered for lunch at work, I brought the leftovers home.  I have not heard my husband so impressed in a long time.  Unfortunately I will no longer be working in the city.  I hope one opens east of the city!

Z9GLKN08-7jRnRREZ7SMUA.text: Multiple times I have had no issues with pizza care... However the couple of times they have messed up my order and been rude to me overpower any good this place does. Tonight's episode is the last straw for me and my family.  Ordering online - you would think it would be easy being 2016 and all - but when showing them what my email receipt compared to their printed out receipt the person behind the counter had only a condescending smirk to offer instead of offering any remedy to the situation. It seemed, at this point, their only course of action was to take the incorrect food away from me without any explanation and to slam it on the back counter is if to signify to my the absolute level of inconvenience I was being. I questioned their actions and received an annoyed glare and absolute silence. I decided at this point it was easier and more effective for me to take back the incorrect food and depart their location. I will never return and I absolutely would not recommend giving this restaurant your business.

VRQ7RZdxF6wK7p8Z1rekHg.text: Would give a zero if possible         To start, I am a very loyal Pizza Care customer, I order from here at least once a week.  However tonight, April 26th, I called to order their special that they have labeled on their "online website" under "HOT DEALS" and ordered the "12 inch hoagie and dozen wings special for $11.99."  We went round and round for 33 minutes arguing about how I was wrong and how this was for their old menu.  I asked him have you ever heard the "customer is always right" phrase and he said yes and then immediatly again said no I am wrong.  He refused to honor Pizza Cares price that they had advertised, and on three separate occasions said "yes Pizza Care will not honor their prices even though they mistakenly advertised their own product."  He admitted that they Falsely advertised their product but refused to honor it, and even saying that they will correct this problem in 2 days saying that it was their IT guys fault.  I even brought up that I have the reciept for when my roommate ordered this same "special" two nights prior with the cashier's name and date, however, this still did not matter.  I said that there was no excuse, it is not the customers fault that you advertised it wrong.  After arguing for 33 minutes and the guy on the phone saying the same thing over and over again, and having admitted multiple times that they were in fact "wrong in this situation," this took a turn for the worst...  The guy on the phone, "Rash-mir," obviously a foreigner based on his accent then asked me if I understood my own language; and I quote "Do you even understand English?"  So after bringing race into this and insulting me, he then went on to say that "you are a waste of my time." This is an absolute disgrace and I will never order again, along with my roommates.  I will also tell everyone I know NOT to order from Pizza Care.  I have recommended Pizza Care to SO MANY people, and now I will go back and tell them otherwise now.  "PIZZA CARE... More like PIZZA DOESN'T CARE"

qJsCqtdv569qRxXG81hqAg.text: My friends and I made it a tradition to order pizza from pizza care every week, it was our go-to pizza place while I went to college in Pittsburgh. Try to get ranch alongside with the pizza, it is absolutely delicious. My favorite part of the pizza is the cheese, which is fantastic.

Qo3CP4Ab6YZDXrBfRjsRrA.text: Order delivery to our hotel during our stay in Pittsburgh .... The fries were good but it wasn't buffalo fries with cheese and bacon .... It was cheese fries with ham., wasn't what we ordered but was good tasting.  The cheesteak ordered was good, the hot buffalo wings were flavored nicely, pizza boat was very good and the crab Rangoon was good just like Chinese place makes them. But pasta with olive oil and garlic was bland not much flavored but overall the food was pretty good for just winging it after a long day to get rest and being hungry

3deoS7ofpY9rR2uiD9Z-FA.text: Massive disappointment. Tiny and not satisfying especially for the 15.99 price for a "medium." Which was tiny. Dry crust, chewy cheese, skimpy toppings. I wasn't greeted for several minutes. Just about walked out. Just don't go, there are much better options in town.

Upd5KWkReurd73q0LlYshw.text: Got mediterranian pasta and salads, 10 xlarge pizzas for friends! The best deal in the area, loved the fresh, hot pizzas! Delivery guy was super nice too. It says it is a healthy pizza shop and i would totally agree on that, crust is really tasty plus the only gluten free pizza i got seemed better than other places! Will be ordering again for sure!   You can really telk it is not the greasy pizza yiu get eveyrwhere, i was just sick of that kind!

WwwxzftZT6oyVUlcTpQGFA.text: Ah, Pizza Care...the variety you offer lives up to your name so well done on that front. The price for the quality of the healthy options? *sad face emoji* I've ordered from this place twice and I'm delighted to report that the food was tasty & delivery service was fast. Since the location teeters on the edge of the Hill District, I've never been inside the joint. They do, however, deliver to Mt Wash!    The latest meal I ordered was a gluten free margarita pizza. The gluten free crust was thin and crispy. I've attempted GF pizza crust countless times and it's a difficult task to master. I'm not sure if Pizza Care buys their GF crust from another company or if they make it in house but either way, round of applause! The crust was delicious. Their margarita style was served with tomato sauce (not diced or sliced tomatoes which I would have preferred) mozzarella slices (not shredded, a plus in my book) and shredded basil. The basil wasn't scarce but it wasn't enough to enjoy in every bite. The ranch served on the side is a nice gesture but I thought it took away from the margarita pizza experience.   Now I know what you're thinking- why the 3 star rating if the food was good and delivery was fast? Allow me to clarify...the pizza was small and priced the same as a large non-GF gourmet pizza. Delivery charge was a $1 so with taxes, my order came to $20 and change. When I say small, I mean it was slightly larger than a personal pan pizza. Enough for two people but not enough to justify the price. Especially with the lackluster basil and tomato sauce instead of slices, I can't place Pizza Care on my list of go-to GF pizza joints.  My fellow foodies: don't rule this place out if you're not concerned with the price!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Gluten free margarita pizza! Served with a side of ranch

QiSHTP7Dr8Pb93vFQm7aOg.text: We started ordering pizza care in the spring of last year and it used to be really tasty, fresh, and our order was always right. However, we recently ordered a few times in the past 6 months or so and our order is always wrong and the quality of the food isn't great. We always order multigrain crust and we are 0/3 on getting it even though it costs extra and we're ordering online. How does that get messed up? The last time we ordered the dough wasn't cooked and the apps we got were really greasy. Blah.

gJPO_ncPSRczDrq3N-rA7g.text: Pepperoni and tomato pizza on whole wheat crust was excellent! I didnt have to wait long either. I will be back to try something else. I hope u will be opening more stores soon!

X1Dnc5g8vSlQr2urBBSaEQ.text: We got the Healthy Pizza with whole grain crust and the buffalo chicken wings. Everything was delicious!! Great "healthy" option for take-out, which we've been looking for for a long time. My only complaint is that we ordered boneless wings but they still sent bone-in, no big deal though.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

wBx11xbovmmnKWCQ66JUDg.text: I've ordered Pizza Care at least five times in the last three months and have been generally  pleased. I've enjoyed pizza, pasta, buffalo fries, salads, and hoagies. I'm giving them three stars  (unofficially 3.5 stars) as a delivery place. If I was comparing this place to the other restaurants I've rated four stars, it would probably only get rated  2.5 stars.   Some of the finer points: -The margarita pizza comes with a side of ranch (and both are equally delicious.)  -Buffalo fries come cut like chips and are deliciously seasoned (not too spicy, but not plain either) -All pastas I've had have been great -Boyfriend got the buffalo pizza and rated it 3 stars. -Cheesy garlic bread :) -The delivery guy has always been on time and courteous.   I've also had an eggplant hoagie, a veggie hoagie, and tomato soup and I probably won't order either of those again. The eggplant was chewy and my tomato soup was just not my favorite. The veggie hoagie was just bad.   So, if you're ordering food to be delivered, Pizza Care should be considered an option.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheesy garlic bread
Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo fries
Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Garlic bread

IMn3GVDwVHoK7KEikFihIA.text: Best delivery pizza I have had in Pittsburgh so far at a decent price. Would order from there again.

DLjdByT0_AvrxsB-SG9Gpg.text: Nom. Nom. Nom. Nom. Nom. Pizza Care really is a unique quality of delivery pizza to order from.  I give it 5 stars despite having one complaint. I'm going to get my one complaint out of the way- And then continue.  The one thing they could improve upon- They don't have Heinz Ketchup as their delivery ketchup packets. This is Pgh, that baffles me. Now, I've accepted this and usually plan around this with my own Heinz brand Ketchup abundantly on hand when needed. Despite their tomato catsup faux pas, I'm still giving them 5 stars for their quality of delivery & food. And here is why---  Pizza Care has options. And I mean high quality, fresh, healthy options like hand crafted gourmet pizza's with fresh mozzarella on a mixed grain crust with hand broken herbs and fresh tomato..... It's a spectrum of choices. They have crafted gourmet pizza items and standard yummy basic white flour crust, shredded mozzarella, perfectly seasoned homemade sauce, & greasy pepperoni pizza everyone loves.   What makes Pizza Care stand out amongst the 1000 other places one can order pizza from in the area? - Ethics. Most places are slinging pizzas trying to lure in college kids with cheap prices and fast delivery.   Pizza Care is using ethical practices & healthier standards. The cheese is all natural real. Olive oil is the oil used. Sodium is limited and only sea salt is used. The flour is unbleached. No preservatives or sugar is used. The care put into their recipes is amazing and the quality shows.   Now trying to decide on what to order from Pizza Care isn't always easy at our house. It varies depending upon our moods. Sometimes we just use a coupon and order a bundled meal deal. There are some great coupons available. We do love to get a XL cheese pizza w xtra cheese & a pepperoni pizza on Sunday's for our evening cable tv splurge.   I highly suggest not overlooking some of the following items. We also love these items:   Buffalo Fries- my husband loves to add these on to an order.  The yummy fresh cut potato bites that are lightly seasoned.  You can add cheese to them with bacon. I prefer them without the added toppings.  I add my own ketchup.   Salads- there are so many salad choices. I love the beet salad customized. From my experience, they have been very nice about customizing salads. The fresh veggie list is extensive. Go crazy.   Pasta- Love the chicken & roasted peppers, the ravioli, and eggplant. All are household favorites. The chicken with peppers is with penne, mushrooms, pepper, in garlic & olive oil and is really good.  Ravioli is served in a red sauce w cheese. Eggplant is served w spaghetti in a red sauce. Both the chicken & eggplant parm are very good.  My kiddo loves the penne pasta. It's just penne, sauce and a layer of cheese. I wouldn't go crazy for it, but they love it.    Gourmet Pizzas- delicious. Yes, they're a bit pricier but they are so good. It's hard to say which is best. The loaded veggies and natural cheese are delicious. You have to decide which are your favorite and customize.   Stromboli- love the spinach. I'm stuck on it so I can't say much about the others. Mostly because I can't stop ordering the spinach when we get the Stromboli.

omuF3FFO6PzZaECbdVrF_A.text: What a strange name - Pizza Care. Does the pizza care and give you a hug or do you care about pizza? Or does it mean the ingredients they use/present appears the company cares about people? Maybe all of the above. I ended up here in the wee hours of the morning after a concert. A slew of people made a walk from Consol to their cars and places. After drinks at the show and a nice walk, there were three of us who were hungry. This place kind of stands alone in between lots/property and is open until 3am Fridays and Saturdays. I'd say this is a plus though I'm not sure how much business they get in those hours and in that area.   They have delivery and a variety of options that would easily appeal to college students (Duquesne, for example). They actually have something called Duquesne Specials with combos available at low prices. The place is well lit and has a large enough seating area. The two gentlemen working behind the counter were nice and recommended a few items to us. We decided on a medium pepperoni pizza between the three of us. It didn't take super long to come out and I thought it was good - not much of a grease factor, which is nice. We ate ours with ranch. The area inside was clean, but I wasn't impressed with the bathroom when I went in to wash my hands. They have the key up front and the door knob was loose/looked like it was about to fall out. It appeared tidy, but the bathroom felt grimy and run down. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here since I don't live nearby, but I wouldn't be opposed to stopping in if I happened to be close and craving pizza.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sharin&#39; a pizza at 1am

W0WJvNEDv6BhM7bL0XFzKQ.text: Pizza and cheese bread was real good.. chicken carbonara left a little to be desired.. delivery was quick and efficient

klkHy1Iyqu0cJN6ZxzDsKw.text: Great pizza! Needed to call to discuss food allergies. Friendly and helpful customer service! Both pizzas we had were delicious. The free breadsticks were plentiful, tasty, and soft. Online ordering was easy; delivery service was efficient and friendly. Enjoy!

aN29sD7xhs2ZfRSEWa6O2g.text: Ordered a vegetable hoagie on whole wheat and a 16" X-Large Whole Wheat Pizza - Tomato Sauce, Mushrooms & Spinach on one half, Fontinella & Broccoli on other. The whole wheat bread with the sandwich was either incorrectly made with white bread or a really sad attempt at wheat. $6.50 was too much for the sandwich, but it was edible.  The pizza was awful. The whole wheat crust was dense and noticeably sweet. Completely wrong for good pizza. The sauce wasn't bad, but it wasn't great. Toppings were fresh enough, but fontinella cheese was bad choice for half the pizza. The mushroom/spinach slices were better, but still not even up to the level of mediocre. I won't order again, but at least the dog has treats for a few days.   Finally, delivery took more than an hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 16&#34; X-Large Whole Wheat Pizza - Tomato Sauce, Mushrooms &amp; Spinach on one half, Fontinella &amp; Broccoli on other.
Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Vegetable hoagie on whole-wheat. Over-priced and nothing special, but better than the pizza.

BFugAJOT4ywqo8DEvpo0jw.text: Really good pizza! Fresh ingredients and fast delivery. Only delivery pizza in Pittsburgh we eat. Never disappoints!

e_QMhGWtSp4E-HwFecAxsA.text: I'm impressed!  Reasonable (maybe a little pricey) prices, but they have a lot of options (plain, whole wheat, whole grain, & gluten-free crust) and nice, fresh ingredients.    I used Eat24 to order this and anywhere that allows me to order from my smartphone is already ahead in my book.   Pizza came nice & hot.  Buffalo fries appear to be freshly cut (not uniform) and also, piping hot.  The delivery driver actually ran up my front steps!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Whole wheat pizza with fresh basil, mushrooms, green pepper and black olives.  Side of Buffalo fries.

2HSIFnxoTnYjl8RBd5FiWA.text: It can't be easy to make fried food tasteless, but Pizza Care can! If you're looking for under-seasoned thick breading, covering also tasteless low quality items, this is the place for you. Nothing is toasted, or crispy. The fried fish came out the same texture as the bread, squishy. The "marinara sauce ", has never met salt. I suspect it's actually canned crushed tomatoes that has once layed near a rosemary container. That's all the spice that could be detected.  This is one of those places that you order take-out from and then spend 20 minutes in your own kitchen, doctoring the food that you bought so that you wouldn't have to cook.

Er1HWsPGKHmMMCx2riiCKg.text: i ordered a buffalo chicken salad and the fried zucchini and both were great! the chicken salad was really spicy (i like hot!) and it had really good flavor. the zucchini was really good but the dipping sauce was ketchup which i thought was weird instead of marinara... but i didn't need a dipping sauce they were good anyways! i ordered around 6 and scheduled for an 8 o clock delivery and they were right on time! delivery man was super friendly too. will definitely order again!

sEKA_6BWXv0Npxvcy0SrDg.text: I ordered delivery and it came in a reasonable time. The garlic bread with cheese was great. I also ordered a small pizza with pepperoni and ham, and it was good, but I could have used more toppings. Pretty reasonably priced and only a couple bucks for delivery.

VUqSUkvPygzATmZviNRbdg.text: I order delivery from this place on the reg, and they're always on-time or early; I've never had an instance where they've been late. They seem to be open all day, every day, and even until 3am on Saturday, which is unusual for a place that I actually enjoy their food. They have the BEST gluten-free pizzas I've ever had! They also have a huge selection of everything that you could possibly imagine, and I've never been disappointed with anything that I've ordered from this place. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

2w1MwstXbGa-2ezupiPhyQ.text: Ok, so i do not know why everybody is being so harsh  on this place because I loved it today! Food is delicious and people here are trying so hard and you can actually see that the food is healthy!  They asked me if i could leave a comment for them so they know how they are doing which i totally understand because it is a new business and competition is high! But A Healthy Pizza i love the idea and food!  I got a specialty pizza and that did not leave me disappointed!  I am very glad to get to know these people and food and i surely am coming back!!!

ncZdbHM6gv-vgWAGl6p8pg.text: I ordered via Grubhub this evening:  1 Tiramisu  and I received Cheesecake- no fruit topping and not note why they sent Cheesecake  1 Traditional White Crust Pizza [10" Small Pizza, Tomato Sauce, [Fresh Mozzarella Cheese, Mushrooms, Baby Spinach]]   and I received a dry bland pizza crust with mushroom, spinach and melted cheese- no tomato sauce, is this really pizza?  1 Broccoli Puffs- these were a bit tough & chewey, but the filling was good.  Needless to day if you can't get 2 of the 3 menu items correct there is an issue.

J6R8ViicC-McUnX44oZ_Zg.text: I decided to give them a go, and I am very glad I did. Everything was delivered piping hot, and delicious.  They also arrived 30 minutes faster than expected!    PS: The cheeseburger hoagie was wonderful - I recommend you try it.

qsvg11zU07oPlsL-hUImIw.text: When I first heard of Pizzacare, I was certain it was the newest alternative to Obamacare. In reality, it's an exceptional pizza joint that's actually looking out for your cholesterol levels. Basically healthcare, right?  When I get Pizza Care pizza, I get the spinach and feta pizza on multigrain crust. How often can you get multigrain crust at a divey pizza shop?! Like, never! The crust is nice and thin with a hearty, grainy texture that pairs nicely with the flavors of the pizza. They are liberal with the toppings and feta cheese to the point that you don't notice it's a white pizza. The garlic sauce in lieu of red sauce is mild but flavorful and soaks nicely into the multigrain crust. I highly recommend this pizza if you're trying to treat yo'self while still maintaining a semblance of health in your diet.   My meat-eating friends all RAVE about the buffalo chicken pizza, and I've never experienced a delivery that was late or an order that was incorrect. Pizza Care-s about your experience!

GEW8Aa8yMBxJ6kPRxX_ToA.text: Terrible Service! DO NOT EAT HERE!   I came in town from a long trip from Los Angeles. I ordered some Pizza and some Fries. After 35min of waiting they messed up my order and gave me Chicken wings instead. Then I when I called to get my order fixed, the guy gave me an attitude and told me to return the mixed order to there store.  I asked are you going to give the customer a cold order of chicken wings? Why would I need to return anything if you mixed up my order. He stated if I don't return the order then I could not get my original order.  You can find a better Pizza Place

CI5bGpjzV7TNTGehPNdUuw.text: We ended up filing a case against this restaurant. It was a plain cheese pizza order delivery. Literally 1 cheese pizza. The restaurant kept telling us that their driver is around the block. They made us waiting downstairs for 45 minutes. We called the restaurant 3 times, each time they told us to keep waiting. In the end, they canceled the order saying the driver was never able to leave the restaurant because he was sick. I cannot believe they LIED to us, and kept assuring us the driving is around the block. If there is no respect for your customers, this FRAUD attitude will come back to you. Unbelievable and preposterous.

-nOxeYlhkDn5QSx1VE-Yhw.text: Took a chance on this place and definitely should not have. I ordered from here yesterday and I do not recommend this place to anyone! The first thing that was wrong was that they only put the toppings I ordered on half of the pizza and just cheese on the other half. I did not order a half/half pizza. Secondly, when we tried to eat it and literally everything just slid off of the crust. Cheese, toppings, and all. Sauce was runny and the pizza had no structure to it at all. First time ever in my life that I have tried to eat pizza with a fork and knife! If you want a messy pizza that requires you eat your toppings and cheese separately from the crust and sauce then this is your place!

ataKqeB59wTJqf9urDjp6g.text: Me and my friends ordered a large cheese pizza ... nothing too difficult, yet it took and hour and a half to get to our house just 6 minutes away. We called the manager for a refund and he hung up. We called again and he said the only way we could get a refund is if we returned the pizza . We waited an hour and a half for pizza why would we return it ?! Horrible customer service ... please avoid.

XzJxFoR68VY2OEu9zwXDsQ.text: Worst customer service I have ever experienced. Took 2 hours to receive the pizza and it was undercooked. We called the restaurant and the manager hung up up on us. We ordered a large cheese pizza nothing that hard.

GVExybNuSV4fzY-1wiOnbw.text: Finally, a pizza place that is accurate, delicious and has worthwhile specials. This was our second time ordering from here and we have found a winner! Our new, go-to pizza delivery place that does not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jalapeño Poppers w Garlic Sauce
Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half pepperoni; half red onion
Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cheesy Breadsticks

f1uUL30NcvyG-3_xAEPdRg.text: The best seafood salad! I love it! Their food is so good, the place is above average clean. The staff are nice and it's in a convenient location. I typically order from them while at work. Love their appetizer platter also!

JmJqxtOrQAyDscdUYM4Wdg.text: I love the Philly cheesesteak pizza! This place is on my way home from work and the service is fast, so it's super convenient. They have so many different specialty pizzas, they'll have something for everyone. They have a lot of healthier options too.

PLBdi1zOmx1PmC1tCEYYVw.text: Ordered here for delivery after a friend recommended this place. Prices are reasonable and the food came within reasonable time.   My friends and I ordered an x-large with half sausage and half mushroom, along with 24 garlic parmesan wings. They gave us extra ranch on the side like we asked. However, I was not very impressed with the food. It was definitely not the worst, but it's not the best either. The pizza sauce was a tad too sweet for my liking. The sausage toppings were overcooked and tasted rubbery. The wings were under seasoned and just bland...boring...bleh.   Overall the food here was edible but not my first choice for pizza.

mkXfCszp0emZjYqctYJjgA.text: The only word that comes to mind is "meh". My husband and I are searching for a new pizza delivery place, since our old standby changed their recipes for the worse. We came across Pizza Care and decided to give it a try.   I was excited to see whole wheat and multi grain crust options, as well as many vegetarian choices. I ordered a multi grain crust with green pepper, onion, and extra cheese. My husband ordered the buffalo chicken pizza.   First of all, our food was $40. We each got a small pizza and a piece of garlic bread. That is crazy to me. The food was all good, but nothing remarkable. No real complaints... but no real accolades either.   I don't think we will order again. Some of the flavor was just lacking, and especially for that price... our pizza search will continue.

nF4o0pXR3dDbWK8voVRa8w.text: I love Pizza Care! I live downtown and they are great for a quick dinner. I love their pizza and hoagies. The buffalo chicken hoagie is the best. Their workers are always nice and I'm pretty sure they already know our address by heart. Also, they give you ranch with your pizza without having to ask and it's SO GOOD!

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Green garden pizza

yfIWTsI5eVa42iFXFs3cVg.text: Pizza Care has great pizza! I've tried a couple different pizzas & they've all been really good. I recommend the multi grain crust, it's flavorful, crispy & not too doughy like some pizzas. Also love the side of ranch they give you with the pizza to dip your crust in.  I've also had the veggie & the fish hoagies. The hoagies were ok, nothing special. Not really worth getting, I would stick with their pizzas.  I really like that they are using healthy ingredients. No preservatives or trans fat, use olive oil in their crusts, healthy crust options & their cheese is all natural. I know pizza isn't exactly healthy for you however it's nice to have a healthy choice if you are going to eat pizza once in a while.  Pizza Care is a great addition to the city & I don't believe there's any other pizza shops around Pittsburgh that have these healthy options.

photos.caption: Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie hoagie
Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fish hoagie
Photo of Pizza Care - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Classic veggie pizza

hdskp-dG6fXTHxqXUHm05A.text: I used to enjoy the ease of ordering from Pizza Care and many of my coworkers began ordering from them, based on my recommendation. Unfortunately neither they nor I will be ordering from them in the future. Today I placed an order during the 11 o'clock hour, to be delivered for a lunch meeting at work. Along with the street number, I included the name of the business and the suite number. Once the meeting started I was not available to answer my phone, so I missed the call from the driver. He refused to deliver the food to my suite and instead offered to meet me in the lobby.   I requested a refund since my food was not delivered as requested. The company will instead only deliver the food to me at another time of my choosing. I'm hoping they'll at least remove the 30+ percent tip I'd already added!

JSs2IJ6nD6mk-ZJKlVmrDA.text: Pizza Care is rapidly becoming my favorite pizza place in Pittsburgh, mostly because of the flexibility in the menu, including and especially some healthy-ish options.  Want a regular pizza?  You can have it.  Need an on-time order for a large party?  They can handle it.  Want a crazy level of topping customization?  They've yet to mess up one of my orders yet, and I've placed plenty of them.  But what really sets them apart is their insistence that pizza doesn't have to be total junk food.  You can swap the crust for something whole wheat or multi-grain (whole wheat options available for hoagie rolls, pasta, and wraps too); there are tons of viable sauce options; they even have low-fat cheese and gluten-free options for pizza crust and pastas.  Over the past year I've been moving more and more of my pizza business to Pizza Care--at this point they're getting well over 90% of my orders (not counting when I'm traveling).  In my opinion, every city should have at least one or two places like this.

9aXTPFp0Qfoe1OPIF2rL5w.text: Didn't even order from this place. All I know is they're open late night and they offer Duquesne University specials which is awesome; but every time I call this place the people are EXTREMELY rude. The customer service is awful. I cannot express in words how bad it is. The first time I called the guy rushed me off the phone, and the second time I called after I finished ordering the guy hung up on me! Beware!

nnOB5qHXvfcgafI68Mb71g.text: Good pizza, very average, little greasy with good cheese. The bread is what makes it underwhelming. Not very good. The bread brings it all down.

bwhZhbdo7MFaRUAdFztMLA.text: I'm sure if you've attempted to order delivery during a Steeler game, you know the turn around time isn't always quick. Sometimes by the time the delivery driver arrives, you want to bite them your so hungry. Lol This place was my first test drive for ordering through Yelp and I was impressed. My order arrived within 35 mins.  We ordered salads and wings (wing dust on half and buffalo on the other). My seafood salad was huge, very fresh and chock full of shrimp, surimi, onions, green peppers, cheese and a good mixture of lettuce. No wet bottom salads here either! It was very good. Did I say it was huge? I still have salad left after eating more for lunch today and will have enough to polish off for lunch tomorrow. 3 meals of salad for 10 bucks....not bad.   The wings were plump and juicy. The wing dust was a bit salty on some pieces but the fix would be to order it on the side. The buffalo sauce was just the right amount of heat and the sauce stuck to the wings well.   The delivery driver was extremely nice making sure I had everything secured so it didn't topple over.  I'm looking forward to trying out some other items on their menu.

Do86oBP2qHmUgBGe_f8dkw.text: I'm a picky eater with veggie wraps so I have a certain way I like to order them. They've nailed it every time. Super good and probably one of my fav pizza places for delivery on yelp!

SgkKxREClH1BV9CtOTgMqA.text: I tried their pizzas before and it was good but last night I made order through Yelp for delivery after a while I gave him a call the guy said 2 minutes so I waited right behind the front door of the emergency room at Mercy Hospital which is to block away from the store after 15 minutes no one showed up I give them a call a game the guy said that I wasn't there so I I told him to send it again I was still waiting after 10 minutes to security felt sorry for me and give them a call he told him 2 minutes and after 15 minutes my wife was discharged and still no pizza so I didn't even bother calling him back
